unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Computer Output T-Test | 2 of 2
question_text:
A study on womenâ€™s weights was recently completed.
Fifteen randomly selected high school females from an urban setting were compared to $16$ randomly selected high school females from a rural setting. Assume that the distribution of both populations are approximately normal. The results are below:
Two-Sample T for Urban Weights vs. Rural Weights
N Mean StDev SE Mean
Urban Weights 15 126.1 10.5 2.7
Rural Weights 16 128.8 13.2 3.3


$\text{Difference }= \mu \text{(Urban Weights)} - \mu \text{(Rural Weights)}$
Estimate for difference: $-2.68$
$95\%$ confidence interval for difference: ($-11.45, 6.09$)
$\text{T-test of difference }= 0$
$\text{T-value }= -0.63$
$\text{P-value }= 0.537$
$\text{DF }= 28$
What conclusions can be made on rural versus urban weights based on the confidence interval above?

choices.text: Rural high school females weigh about $2.68\text{ pounds}$ more than urban high school females.
Rural high school females weigh about $2.68\text{ pounds}$ less than urban high school females.
No evidence exists of a significant difference between urban and rural high school female weights since the interval contains $0$.
No evidence exists of a significant difference between urban and rural high school female weights since the interval contains $2.68$.
Intervals such as this one will capture the sample mean difference in $95\%$ of repeated samples.
